shorts.title: Author discusses Beatles, religion at University of Scranton
shorts.title_distilled: Author discusses Beatles, religion at University of Scranton.
shorts.description: Author Jeffery D. Long, Ph.D., the Carl W. Zeigler professor of religion, philosophy and Asian studies at Elizabethtown College, presented “Peace, Love and God-consciousness: George Harrison, The Beatles and Hinduism” at a lecture at the University of Scranton in March. The lecture was sponsored by the university’s Slattery Center, Jesuit Center, Department of Theology/Religious Studies, Asian Studies Concentration, and Peace and Justice Studies Concentration. From left: Christian Krokus, Ph.D., professor of theology and religious studies at Scranton; Patrick Beldio, Ph.D., visiting assistant professor of theology and religious studies at Scranton; Long and his wife, Mahua Bhattachara, Ph.D., professor of Japanese […]
shorts.content: Author Jeffery D. Long, Ph.D., the Carl W. Zeigler professor of religion, philosophy and Asian studies at Elizabethtown College, presented “Peace, Love and God-consciousness: George Harrison, The Beatles and Hinduism” at a lecture at the University of Scranton in March. The lecture was sponsored by the university’s Slattery Center, Jesuit Center, Department of Theology/Religious Studies, Asian Studies Concentration, and Peace and Justice Studies Concentration. From left: Christian Krokus, Ph.D., professor of theology and religious studies at Scranton; Patrick Beldio, Ph.D., visiting assistant professor of theology and religious studies at Scranton; Long and his wife, Mahua Bhattachara, Ph.D., professor of Japanese […]

shorts.title: Moosic High School to hold final All Class Reunion
shorts.title_distilled: Moosic High School to hold final All Class Reunion.
shorts.description: The Moosic High School Committee for the annual All Class Reunion has decided the reunion has run its course and this year will be the finale. This year’s reunion will be held earlier than usual on Saturday, Aug. 16, at St. George’s Center, 730 S. Keyser Ave., Taylor, from noon-4 p.m. Letters have been sent to class members who attended the high school. The reunion is open to members and their guests. The price of the reunion is $40/person. Reservations are necessary and close Friday. If you have not received a letter or have questions, contact Barbara Zikoski Sincavage at […]
shorts.content: The Moosic High School Committee for the annual All Class Reunion has decided the reunion has run its course and this year will be the finale. This year’s reunion will be held earlier than usual on Saturday, Aug. 16, at St. George’s Center, 730 S. Reservations are necessary and close Friday. If you have not received a letter or have questions, contact Barbara Zikoski Sincavage at […]
shorts.content_distilled: Moosic High School Committee for the annual All Class Reunion has decided the reunion has run its course and this year will be the finale.

shorts.title: Police seek missing Moosic man
shorts.description: Moosic police are looking for a young borough man and are seeking the public’s assistance in locating him. Nicholas Terrery, 23, was last seen in the vicinity of Kipling Drive around 10:45 a.m. Saturday, police said. He was wearing a white golf hat, blue shirt and dark-colored shorts. Police said his last known location was Litzy’s Lounge in Avoca at approximately 9:55 p.m. Saturday. Anyone with information about Terrery’s current location is asked to contact the Moosic Borough Police Department through the Lackawanna County Communications Center at 570-342-9111.

Anyone with information about Terrery’s current location is asked to contact the Moosic Borough Police Department through the Lackawanna County Communications Center at 570-342-9111.

shorts.title: Scranton Jazz Festival Returns This Weekend
shorts.title_distilled: Scranton Jazz Festival Returns This Weekend.
shorts.description: The Scranton Jazz Festival celebrates its 20th anniversary with events across 23 venues this weekend.
